title: October 21, 2019: Chainlink (LINK): Up 8.52%; 2nd Consecutive Up Day
text:
How Did Chainlink’s Price Fare Yesterday?

Chainlink is up by approximately 8.52% from the previous day, with its price currently hovering around $2.648 USD. This marked the the 2nd day in a row Chainlink has been up; it is still in a unclear trend, and is currently 12.2% above its 20 day moving average; staying above this level may be critical to sustain short-term momentum. Chainlink’s expected trading range — as forecasted by the Bollinger bands indicator, which determines a range based on momentum and volatility over the past two weeks — is between $2.04465 and $2.67555. Given its boundaries, rangebound traders may find it compelling to entertain selling, as we are nearer to the top of the range.

Trade Chainlink (LINK) and over 500 other cryptos across ten different exchanges — all from one app. Try Quadency.

As for Chainlink’s market cap, it is currently at about $857M US dollars.

Update on Transactions and Holders

7,287 transactions amongst holders of Chainlink occurred yesterday. Regarding a tally of holders, Yesterday saw Chainlink’s wallet count increase by 187. Our engagement rank, which combines weekly percentage growth in number of holders and number of transfers, has Chainlink ranked 6 out of the 34 Ethereum tokens we’re tracking.

Observing Chainlink’s Richest Wallets

Of the coin’s total money supply, the richest 1,0000 wallets currently own 91.91%. Drilling down to just exchanges, the top 1,000 wallets that are exchanges control 0.95% of the currency’s money supply. Exchange ownership grew by -0.03% over the past week, while the overall ownership percentage of the top 1,000 richest wallets grew by -0.02% over that time period.

How Much Development is Occurring?

The last activity date on Chainlink’s GitHub repository was October 20, 2019, or about 1 days ago. Over the past 30 days, we’ve seen open issues across Chainlink’s GitHub repositories grow by -0.13 per day on average, while the number of watchers has grown by 1.1.

The Latest on Chainlink and Social Media

If you are interested in following Chainlink on social media, Twitter, where it has 35,761 following it, may be a good place to start. You can follow Chainlink on Twitter here.

Where to Buy

You can trade Chainlink, listed under the symbol LINK, through the following exchanges: Gate, Yobit, Binance, DDEX.

Article by SixJupiter
